alert.note: Alert for Nassau (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 1:56PM EDT until July 25 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Nassau and Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen across northern Nassau and northwestern Suffolk counties. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1 1/2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Commack, Huntington Station, Centereach, Plainview, Hauppauge, Ronkonkoma, Syosset, Mineola, Huntington, Westbury, Stony Brook, Port Jefferson, Northport, Oyster Bay, Hicksville, Dix Hills, Smithtown, Melville, Port Washington and Farmingville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
